thread.title: Five Hawks who impresses in preseason win over Cavs
thread.title_full: Five Hawks who impresses in preseason win over Cavs

title: Five Hawks who impresses in preseason win over Cavs
text:
5 Hawks Who Were Impressive In Preseason Win Over Cavs Joe Robbins/NBAE/Getty Images Content URL Copy 
The Atlanta Hawks were back in action Wednesday for their first of 7 tune-ups before the regular season opener. They knocked off the Cavaliers 98-96 in Cincinnati. Here are 5 players who impressed in the win: 
1) Jeff Teague 
Teague set the tone early by being aggressive and looking for his shot. He found a rhythm: 7-9 shooting and 17 points in 21 minutes. 
2) Edy Tavares 
Tavares made his NBA debut in the third quarter and was very impressive. The 7'3" center made his presence felt around the rim to the tune of 5-5 shooting and 11 points overall. He also grabbed 4 boards and had 2 steals. 
3) Kent Bazemore 
Bazemore said he spent the summer working on his jump shots, and he showed signs of his hard working paying off in the first game. He went 5-8 overall and 2-3 from three. 
4) Al Horford 
After a slow start, Horford exploded in the third quarter. He finished 5-10 overall and grabbed 8 boards to go with his 15 points. 
5) Shelvin Mack 
Mack is a constant reminder of just how deep the Hawks are at point guard. He recorded 5 assists in 13 minutes, several to Tavares, and managed the offense well while on the floor. 
Story by Jaryd Wilson
